title: Conservation of energy - sliding down a ramp

content.question: A block slides down a rough ramp starting from rest at a height of <math alttext="20 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> and reaches a final speed of <math alttext="16 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math> at the bottom of the ramp. Which of the following systems of objects experiences a decrease in energy and what reasoning justifies this answer?

choices.label: The block-ramp system, because the surface of the ramp does negative work on the block which reduces the total energy of the system.
The block-ramp system, because the Earth does negative work on the block which reduces the total energy of the system.
The block-Earth system. The component of the force exerted by the ramp's surface on the block parallel to the ramp dissipates energy, reducing the mechanical energy of the system.
The block-Earth system. The component of the force exerted by the ramp's surface on the block perpendicular to the ramp dissipates energy, reducing the mechanical energy of the system.

content.answer: The block-Earth system. The component of the force exerted by the ramp's surface on the block parallel to the ramp dissipates energy, reducing the mechanical energy of the system.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
